column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I was on the .0375 and now on .05.  It has regulated my sleep and emotions.  To easily remove the adhesive

column1: 1$"Condition: ""Change of Life"" Signs"$3/25/2015 11:55:21 AM$Reviewer: katydid
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $4$4$4$I have been using this .5 mg patch for the past 11 days- changing it every 3 days- and I feel significantly better as far as mood and I sleep very well.  That is a miracle. I did not know poor sleep was a side effect of low estrogen.  So happy I did not have to resort to sleeping pills. I am worried about developing a rash from the patch but so far so good.

6$"Condition: ""Change of Life"" Signs"$2/2/2013 3:15:25 PM$Reviewer: Feeling' Fantastic
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$I began using a very low dose patch due to hot flashes
column5: mood swings and difficulty concentrating. All of these irritating symptoms are either gone or so mild that I can ignore them.  Please note
column7: which also helps prevent mood swings and difficulty concentrating
column8: but I don't experience the foggy thinking which usually accompanies the use of antidepressants. I have no skin irritation from the patch's adhesive. It adheres well to my skin; no premature peeling. If one dose of the patch is too strong and the next lower dose is too weak
column9: the patch with the stronger dose may be trimmed before application
column11: without worry of it peeling off prematurely. I love using the patch. It has greatly improved my quality of life.

column1: 9$Condition: Low Estrogen After Operation to Remove Ovaries$10/18/2009 1:30:55 AM$Reviewer: Jessica
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$Starting using the patch after Hysterectomy at 31
column3: went two weeks without it and after mood swings and hot flashes starting urgently went and got it filled! Thank God
column5: the only real problem is the rash circles from the patch
column6: moved it to my back-side and hoping it wont be so tender there! It itches when it doesnt get any air to that spot where it has been on my stomach even though I have moved it many times and almost every 3-4 days reapplying it to another spot on my tummy! But it is a whole lot better than how I felt before my surgery and post op without any hormones to keep me sane.....being ill all the time is awful!!  I have been having mild migraines but they usually go away after a long hot bath and some pain medication!!  I never thought I would be going through this at my age but I know I'm not the only one!  Hope this helps!  Read up on some of the drug interactions on this site...didnt know anything about those...good to know in advance what may interact
column7: my pharmacist never said anything nor did my OBGYN!! -Good Luck- Jessica of AL

column1: 10$"Condition: ""Change of Life"" Signs"$3/9/2009 1:14:28 AM$Reviewer: 45-54 Female  (Patient) $5$5$5$This was great - it stopped the night sweats

column1: 13$"Condition: ""Change of Life"" Signs"$11/30/2008 11:11:48 PM$Reviewer: Pat
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$4$3$Like the patch. Put it on and forget it. Drawbacks are my skin gets irritated wherever I put it so I have to find new spots and thats the second problem. Finding unexposed skin wher it won't rub off.

column1: 14$"Condition: ""Change of Life"" Signs"$7/2/2008 9:27:20 AM$Reviewer: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $2$1$3$"I found the medication did help slightly with vaginal dryness
column2: but it was not worth the little bit of benifit. I was left with discoloration on my skin for weeks on each spot that I placed the patch. I began to feel like a dalmation. I have stopped using the patch and I feel the same as prior to use. I prefer the use of vaginal cream to treat the dryness I experience rather than use the patch again for the small amunt of benifit I received. It may work well for other women with ""hot flashes"" and other symptoms
column3: so talk to your doctor about the risks and benifits and do research. This product may work for you. Good luck!"
